title: Notion Calender
content:
# Notion Calendar App Guide

## Navigation
- **Main View**: The home screen displays a time-grid schedule. Use the **Hamburger menu** (top-left) to access different calendars or settings.
- **Date Navigation**: The current month (e.g., "February") is displayed at the top with a dropdown arrow to change dates. The current day is highlighted in red (e.g., "Tue 3").
- **Meeting Status**: A floating bar at the bottom provides a quick summary of your schedule, such as **"No upcoming meeting"**.

## Search
- **Find Events**: Tap the **Magnifying Glass icon** in the top-right corner of the main view to search for specific events.

## Common Actions
- **Create Event**: Tap the floating **Plus (+)** button at the bottom right to schedule a new item.
- **Edit Event Details**: In the creation screen, enter the **Title** (e.g., "Hhj") and set the **Time** (e.g., "10:30 PM -> 11 PM"). You can also toggle **All-day**, **Time zone**, or **Repeat** options directly below the time.
- **Add Context**: Use the dedicated fields to add **Participants**, set up **Conferencing** (video link), add a **Location**, or write a **Description**.
- **Save**: Tap the **Done** button in the top-right corner to save your event.

## Tips
- **Quick Jump**: The top header clearly highlights the current date (e.g., "3") to help you orient yourself in the weekly/daily grid.
- **Visual Grid**: The app uses a clean dark-mode grid where time slots (1 AM, 2 AM, etc.) are vertically listed, making it easy to spot gaps in your schedule.
